issue.title: PYTHON_EXECUTABLE Required to be set during build
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-780](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-780). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
I had to set PYTHON_EXECUTABLE to my conda environment's Python interpreter. [~wesm_impala_7e40] says he doesn't have to. We should clarify whether this is necessary, if it in fact is.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-780?focusedCommentId=15968330) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Is this still an issue?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-780?focusedCommentId=15968344) by Phillip Cloud (cpcloud):*
Yes. `[~wesmckinn]` Can you show the output of your cmake when building arrow-cpp? I'd like to see what it should be doing for reference.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-780?focusedCommentId=15969077) by Phillip Cloud (cpcloud):*
This seems to be something specific to the `Makefile`s that `clion` is generating. Running this on the command line works fine.
